head.supplied: 6/10/87 ¶ ¶ I have not felt at all well since yesterday, dear My Hyndman, and thus, much to my regret, I shall be prevented, to attend at the festival, to which the Austr. Artists Association me so g...

div.p: MS7593, 583/2(a), La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

I have not felt at all well since yesterday, dear My Hyndman, and thus, much to my regret, I shall be prevented, to attend at the festival, to which the Austr. Artists Association me so generously invited.
See M to R. Hyndman, 29 September 1887. Thus — I fear, that I may also be unable, to avail myself of the privilege, so kindly conceded to me, of being present, while His Excellency and Lady Loch
Henry Brougham and Elizabeth Loch. and other distinguished personages will tomorrow inspect the new winter work of our many clever artists.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
